title: Sidewall, 1780–90
medium: Block-printed on handmade paper, distemper colors
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Medallion of large shallow bowl, with three feet and link handles, filled with flowers, alternates with scene of woman under an arched lattice playing with a cupid. Framework of ribbon festoons, garlands and scrolls. Printed in reds, greens and blues on a pale blue field. Vertical rectangle.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Sidewall, 1780–90.
1780–90. Block-printed on handmade paper, distemper colors. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1925-1-23.
